name: Gau
title: Barbarian of Frozen Lands

soulWeapon.advancement0: Summons the soul of Holy Bird, Numinu, increasing own ATK by 60% for 8 sec. Upon activation, summons the Storm of Numinu in the front for 8 sec, dealing ??? P.DMG every 0.5 sec to enemies within range and reducing the target's ATK Spd by 100 for 5 sec. The ATK Spd Reduction effect can be stacked up to max 10 times. Enemies with 10 stacks are inflicted with Freeze adnt ake 30% increases P.DMG for 5 sec.
soulWeapon.advancement1: Increases the duration of Storm of Numinu and soul by 4 sec.
soulWeapon.advancement2: Changes the increased P.DMG the enemies take to 50%, and every hit dispels positiv effects from the enemy.
soulWeapon.activation: Charges up upon using Skills 4 times.

dark: Heals HP worth 10% of ATK every second, and every 1% of HP lost reduces received DMG by 0.6%.

background.story: Gau is a powerful warrior from the Barbarian Kingdom. Whenever he swung his twin axes, a bloodbath would follow. As a warrior, he was feared for his peerless ferocity. However, he suddenly disappeared for 10 years. When he returned, he was a completely changed man. His violent Barbarian tendencies were all gone, even when others criticized him. Instead, he now faces them with smiles and jolly laughter. The kind, warm gaze he now shows to children and animals is especially surprising.

itemIntroductions.weapon: It is said that there lives a sacred beast protecting the Barbarians in the Windland Snow Mountain. This beast, capable of dispelling the power of darkness, is supposed to be a blue phoenix composed of ice. Created in the shape of this beast is Numinu, its name means 'holy.' It has been crafted from enchanted ice that never melts. Considered a holy relic among Barbarians, this weapon is bestowed to their mightiest warrior. The wielder of this weapon is the most powerful warrior among Barbarians, and may be considered their king.
itemIntroductions.soul:
Numinu is the weapon that only the strongest Barbarian warrior may carry.
However, its current master, Gau, did not dare to use the weapon.
For he knew Numinu was the sacred relic of the Barbarian Tribe to slay darkness, and as someone who had abandoned his kingdom and his people, he believed that he was not worthy of holding it.
All he could do was to repent for his past sins silently by help rebuilding the kingdom.
But it did not take long until his endless devotion toward his people saw the light. The Barbarians started praising Gau's display of diligence and truthfulness, and one by one, the Barbarians recognized him as their leader.
Numinu, who was watching over Gau ever since the beginning, launched itself far upwards the sky and incarnated before Gau.
It was the day Gau became the true king of the Barbarians.
treasures: A worn-out helmet of Frost Giant King. It was last used by the darkness-ridden Frost Giant King. Gau, hoping that the tragedy of Windland Snow Mountain won't repeat itself, keeps this broken helmet to mourn the fallen hero.

Trumpet made with the horn of the guardian beast of Windland Snow Mountain, Orox. Orox of the Snowy Mountain grants noble warriors great power and the ability to see the truth. When a warrior who has received the blessing of Orox blows this horn, it will boost the morale of comrades and bring clarity to their minds.

Mug of the Barbarian King who first settled down in the snowy mountains. When the first Barbarian King settled down in Windland, he swore to become the guardian of the snowy mountains and shared this mug with the holy beings of the mountains. The protect magic of the frost wolf imbued in the Barbarian Mug increases the ATK of Vortex and the effect of Freeze.

A bracelet made with a Snowdrop Flower. Although it was made with clumsy hands, the children at the orphanage made this bracelet as a birthday gift for Gau after seeing him grieve for his fallen Barbarian tribes. A Snowdrop means hope and comfort in the language of flowers.
